Utilities¶

GoatTracker Functions¶

import_sng_file_to_rchirp¶

ctsGoatTracker.import_sng_file_to_rchirp(input_filename, subtune_number=0)[source]¶

Convert a GoatTracker sng file (normal or stereo) into an RChirp song instance

Parameters

  • input_filename (str) – sng input path and filename

  • subtune_number (int, optional) – the subtune number, defaults to 0

Returns

An RChirp song for the subtune

Return type

RChirpSong

import_sng_file_to_parsed_gt¶

ctsGoatTracker.import_sng_file_to_parsed_gt(input_filename)[source]¶

Parse a goat tracker ‘.sng’ file and put it into a GTSong instance. Supports 1SID and 2SID (stereo) goattracker ‘.sng’ files.

Parameters

input_filename (string) – Filename for input .sng file

Returns

A GTSong instance holding the parsed goattracker file

Return type

GTSong

import_sng_binary_to_parsed_gt¶

ctsGoatTracker.import_sng_binary_to_parsed_gt(sng_bytes)[source]¶

Parse a goat tracker ‘.sng’ binary and put it into a GTSong instance. Supports 1SID and 2SID (stereo) goattracker ‘.sng’ file binaries.

Parameters

sng_bytes (bytes) – Binary contents of a sng file

Returns

A GTSong instance holding the parsed goattracker file

Return type

GTSong

export_rchirp_to_gt¶

ctsGoatTracker.export_rchirp_to_gt(rchirp_song, output_filename, end_with_repeat=False, pattern_len=126)[source]¶

Convert rchirp into a goattracker .sng file.

Parameters

  • output_filename (string) – Output path and filename

  • rchirp_song (RChirpSong) – The rchirp song to convert

  • end_with_repeat (bool, optional) – True if song should repeat when finished, defaults to False

  • pattern_len (int, optional) – Maximum pattern lengths to create

Contains parsed .sng data.

3 or 6 voices

wave table

C128 BASIC Play Functions¶

ctsC128Basic.export_midi_to_C128_BASIC(mchirp_song, instrum=('piano', 'piano', 'piano'), arch='NTSC-C64')[source]¶

Convert mchirp into a C128 Basic program that plays the song.

Parameters

  • mchirp_song (MChirpSong) – An mchirp song

  • instrum (tuple, optional) – tuple of instrument string names, defaults to (‘piano’, ‘piano’, ‘piano’)

  • arch (str, optional) – Commodore architecture, defaults to ‘NTSC-C64’

Raises

  • ChiptuneSAKContentError – Various content errors

  • ChiptuneSAKValueError – Various value errors

Returns

Returns a binary BASIC file

Return type

bytes

ctsGenPrg.ascii_to_prg_c128(ascii_prg)[source]¶

Convert an ascii C128 BASIC program into a tokenized binary BASIC file

Parameters

ascii_prg (str) – C128 BASIC program in ascii

Returns

binary BASIC file suitable for running on a C128

Return type

bytes

ML64 Functions¶

ctsML64.export_mchirp_to_ml64(mchirp_song)[source]¶

Export the song in ML64 format, grouping notes into measures. The measure comments are guaranteed to appear at the beginning of each measure; tied notes will be split to accommodate the measure markers. :param mchirp_song: An mchirp song :type mchirp_song: MChirpSong

Lilypond sheetmusic Functions¶

ctsLilypond.export_song_to_lilypond(mchirp_song, auto_sort=False)[source]¶

Converts a song to Lilypond format. Optimized for multi-page PDF output of the song. Recommended lilypond command:

lilypond <filename>

Parameters

  • mchirp_song (MChirpSong) – ChirpSong to convert to Lilypond format

  • auto_sort (bool, optional) – Autosort the tracks, defaults to False

Returns

Lilypond markup ascii

Return type

str

ctsLilypond.export_clip_to_lilypond(mchirp_song, measures)[source]¶

Turns a set of measures into Lilypond suitable for use as a clip. All the music will be on a single line with no margins. It is recommended that this clip be turned into Lilypond using the command line:

lilypond -ddelete-intermediate-files -dbackend=eps -dresolution=600 -dpixmap-format=pngalpha –png <filename>

Parameters

  • mchirp_song (MChirpSong) – ChirpSong from which the measures were taken.

  • measures (list) – List of measures.

Returns

Lilypond markup ascii

Return type

str

ChiptuneSAK
